Wisdom: لَمْ يَذْهَبْ مِنْ مَالِكَ مَا وَقَى عِرْضَكَ
enWisdom: That portion of your wealth which is used to safeguard your dignity has not gone [to waste]
One who sacrifices his dignity is abased
One who sacrifices his dignity is humiliated
One who preserves his dignity is revered

Wisdom: مَا صَانَ الْأَعْرَاضَ كَالْإِعْرَاضِ عَنِ الدَّنَايَا وَسُوءِ الْأَغْرَاضِ
enWisdom: Nothing preserves reputations like turning away from vile traits and evil objectives
Abundance of wealth [that is attained] by the derogation of reputations is ignobility
The plenitude of dignity is [attained] through the generous spending of wealth

Wisdom: لَا تَفْعَلْ مَا يَشِينُ الْعِرْضَ وَالِاسْمَ
enWisdom: Do not do that which will lower your dignity and your reputation

Wisdom: لَا تَجْعَلْ عِرْضَكَ غَرَضاً لِقَوْلِ كُلِّ قَائِلٍ
enWisdom: Do not make your dignity a subject of the speech of every speaker [by engaging in shameful deeds]
